member.name: T:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceService
member.summary: Helper class responsible for creating and managing the GraphicsDevice. All GraphicsDeviceControl instances share the same GraphicsDeviceService, so even though there can be many controls, there will only ever be a single underlying GraphicsDevice. This implements the standard IGraphicsDeviceService interface, which provides notification events for when the device is reset or disposed.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceService.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor is private, because this is a singleton class: client controls should use the public AddRef method instead.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceService.AddRef(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a reference to the singleton instance.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceService.Release(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases a reference to the singleton instance.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceService.ResetDevice(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets the graphics device to whichever is bigger out of the specified resolution or its current size. This behavior means the device will demand-grow to the largest of all its GraphicsDeviceControl clients.

member.name: P:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceService.GraphicsDevice
member.summary: Gets the current graphics device.

member.name: T:TileEditor.ServiceContainer
member.summary: Container class implements the IServiceProvider interface. This is used to pass shared services between different components, for instance the ContentManager uses it to locate the IGraphicsDeviceService implementation.

member.name: M:TileEditor.ServiceContainer.AddService``1(``0)
member.summary: Adds a new service to the collection.

member.name: M:TileEditor.ServiceContainer.GetService(System.Type)
member.summary: Looks up the specified service.

member.name: T:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl
member.summary: Custom control uses the XNA Framework GraphicsDevice to render onto a Windows Form. Derived classes can override the Initialize and Draw methods to add their own drawing code.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.OnCreateControl
member.summary: Initializes the control.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the control.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Redraws the control in response to a WinForms paint message.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.BeginDraw
member.summary: Attempts to begin drawing the control. Returns an error message string if this was not possible, which can happen if the graphics device is lost, or if we are running inside the Form designer.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.EndDraw
member.summary: Ends drawing the control. This is called after derived classes have finished their Draw method, and is responsible for presenting the finished image onto the screen, using the appropriate WinForms control handle to make sure it shows up in the right place.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.HandleDeviceReset
member.summary: Helper used by BeginDraw. This checks the graphics device status, making sure it is big enough for drawing the current control, and that the device is not lost. Returns an error string if the device could not be reset.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.PaintUsingSystemDrawing(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String)
member.summary: If we do not have a valid graphics device (for instance if the device is lost, or if we are running inside the Form designer), we must use regular System.Drawing method to display a status message.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.OnPaintBackground(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Ignores WinForms paint-background messages. The default implementation would clear the control to the current background color, causing flickering when our OnPaint implementation then immediately draws some other color over the top using the XNA Framework GraphicsDevice.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.Initialize
member.summary: Derived classes override this to initialize their drawing code.

member.name: M:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.Draw
member.summary: Derived classes override this to draw themselves using the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: P:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.GraphicsDevice
member.summary: Gets a GraphicsDevice that can be used to draw onto this control.

member.name: P:TileEditor.GraphicsDeviceControl.Services
member.summary: Gets an IServiceProvider containing our IGraphicsDeviceService. This can be used with components such as the ContentManager, which use this service to look up the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: T:TileEditor.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:TileEditor.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:TileEditor.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: The main entry point for the application.
